result.execSummary:
The defendant Conner A Husted was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No contact wtih E.M.H., her family or residence.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions, commencing FORTHWITH.
Apply 137 days sentence credit.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Probation revoked, sentence imposed.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Conner A Husted in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel P Fay.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
250 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
137 Days Credit.
FORTHWITH.

Any outstanding costs/fines are to be converted to a civil judgment.
Dated 07/22/16, from Atty Fay, with attached cover letters.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing After Revoction documents filed by Department of Corrections.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Conner A Husted in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations to the court.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:  
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation: 1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  E.M.H. her family or residence.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Sentencing recommendation with attachments filed by Attorney Fay.
